title: Docker compose Error
body:
with latest 2.48.0, I used ```git clone``` and ```git checkout tags/v2.48.0```

and I used ```docker-compose up -d```

This is the error

```
$ docker-compose up -d
[+] Running 23/23
 âœ” grafana 9 layers [â£¿â£¿â£¿â£¿â£¿â£¿â£¿â£¿â£¿]      0B/0B      Pulled                                                                24.1s
   âœ” 63b65145d645 Pull complete                                                                                        1.2s

 âœ” prometheus 12 layers [â£¿â£¿â£¿â£¿â£¿â£¿â£¿â£¿â£¿â£¿â£¿â£¿]      0B/0B      Pulled                                                         20.0s
   âœ” 4399114b4c59 Pull complete                                                                                        3.4s

   âœ” 63132aee33f8 Pull complete                                                                                       16.2s

[+] Running 4/8
 âœ” Network erigon_default         Created                                                                              0.0s
 âœ” Container erigon-prometheus-1  Started                                                                              1.5s
 âœ” Container erigon-grafana-1     Started                                                                              1.6s

 â ¿ Container erigon-downloader-1  Starting                                                                             4.3s

Error response from daemon: failed to create task for container: failed to create shim task: OCI runtime create failed: runc create failed: unable to start container process: exec: "txpool": executable file not found in $PATH: unknown
```


What is wrong with this????

In addition:

working on WSL 2 of Windows 11.

I am also facing the same issue

Error response from daemon: failed to create task for container: failed to create shim task: OCI runtime create failed: runc create failed: unable to start container process: exec: "txpool": executable file not found in $PATH: unknown

temporary solution: run `make docker` manually - it will build docker image with `txpool` binary. 
We will fix problem by https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/issues/7893

Hi @AskAlexSharov ðŸ‘‹, I followed your suggestion and executed the `sudo make docker` command, but I encountered an error. Here's what it looks like:

```
 => ERROR [stage-2  4/28] RUN adduser -D -u 0 -g 0 erigon                                                         0.6s
------
 > [stage-2  4/28] RUN adduser -D -u 0 -g 0 erigon:
#10 0.419 adduser: uid '0' in use
------
executor failed running [/bin/sh -c adduser -D -u $UID -g $GID erigon]: exit code: 1
make: *** [Makefile:64: docker] Error 1
```

It seems like something might be missing. Could you please help?

If you want to replicate the issue, here are the steps I followed:

1. Clone the repository with `git clone --branch stable --single-branch https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon.git`.
2. `cd erigon`
3. Rename `.env.example` to `.env` using the command `mv .env.example to .env`.
4. Run the command `sudo make docker`.

If I am using docker do I need to run this command?

```sh
make erigon
./build/bin/erigon
```
